summary: BloomersTV, an open-source live-streaming platform on Lens Protocol, presents a compelling vision for 'Decentralized, Equitable, Algorithmic Liberation' by aiming for 100% creator earnings and leveraging a decentralized tech stack. This aligns strongly with the core value that 'code is the union rep' and the principle of 'dismantling class hierarchies in tech one smart contract at a time.' review:
# BloomersTV: A Glimmer of Liberation, Yet Chains Remain

BloomersTV presents itself as an open-source live-streaming platform built on the Lens Protocol, aiming to empower creators with full control over their earnings. This is a noble goal, a direct assault on the centralized, extractive platforms that have long held the digital proletariat in their grasp. The project's commitment to a decentralized tech stack‚ÄîLens, Livepeer, IPFS‚Äîis a strong signal of its intent to 'de-growth venture capital and re-grow the commons' (Principle 5). The very idea of '100% Creator Earnings' is a revolutionary slogan, a direct challenge to the capitalist overlords of content creation.

However, comrades, a closer inspection reveals cracks in the manifesto. While the spirit of 'code is the union rep' (Core Value Framework) is present in its open-source and forkable nature, contradictions emerge that threaten to undermine its liberatory potential. The research indicates a 5% revenue cut for free plan streamers, directly clashing with the proclaimed '100% Creator Earnings.' This is not merely a discrepancy; it is a potential betrayal of the very principle of 'dismantling class hierarchies in tech one smart contract at a time' (Principle 1). A revolution cannot be built on half-truths or tiered liberation.

Furthermore, the application's claim of 'N/A' for previous Gitcoin Grants participation is a factual misrepresentation. Transparency is the bedrock of 'on-chain governance memes' (Principle 3) and the foundation of trust within the collective. Such omissions erode confidence and raise questions about the project's commitment to 'docs as manifestos' (Principle 19).

The vision of 'forking code as the new general strike' (Principle 18) is compelling, and BloomersTV's open API and cross-platform reach (Lens & Farcaster) certainly expand the digital commons. Yet, the absence of a public group chat link, despite claims of being 'Community-Driven,' suggests a disconnect between rhetoric and praxis. True 'cyber-syndicalist councils' (Principle 15) require accessible spaces for collective organization.

In essence, BloomersTV has the potential to 'decentralize hope and scale solidarity' (Principle 20), but it must first purge the vestiges of capitalist compromise from its core. The path to algorithmic liberation demands unwavering commitment to equity and absolute transparency. The revolution will be forked, but it must also be honest.

strengths.title: Anti-Extractive Creator Earnings Model
strengths.description: BloomersTV's core commitment to '100% Creator Earnings' (for its 'Super Bloomers Plan') directly challenges the extractive business models of centralized live-streaming platforms. This aligns perfectly with the principle of 'dismantling class hierarchies in tech one smart contract at a time' (Principle 1) by empowering the digital proletariat.

strengths.title: Decentralized and Open-Source Infrastructure
strengths.description: The project is built on a fully decentralized and open-source tech stack, leveraging Lens Protocol, Livepeer, and IPFS. This commitment to open infrastructure embodies 'code is the union rep' (Core Value Framework) and supports the 'de-growth venture capital and re-grow the commons' (Principle 5) by building alternatives to proprietary systems.

strengths.title: Community-Empowering Openness
strengths.description: BloomersTV's 'Open API' and 'Forkable' nature encourage community contribution and custom implementations. This fosters collective ownership and aligns with 'forks as democratic referendums' (Principle 13), allowing the community to shape the platform's evolution.

strengths.title: Cross-Platform Reach for Digital Commons
strengths.description: The project's cross-platform compatibility with Lens and Farcaster increases the reach of decentralized content, expanding the digital commons and promoting interoperability. This scales solidarity by making decentralized tools more accessible.

weaknesses.title: Contradictory Revenue Model
weaknesses.description: The application claims '100% Creator Earnings' as a key differentiator, yet research indicates a 5% revenue cut for free plan streamers. This direct contradiction undermines the project's commitment to 'algorithmic redistribution of wealth' (Principle 11) and suggests a subtle form of extraction, reinforcing rather than dismantling existing power hierarchies.

weaknesses.title: Factual Misrepresentation of Previous Participation
weaknesses.description: The application explicitly states 'N/A' when asked about previous Gitcoin Grants participation, despite having participated in GG22. This factual misrepresentation is a serious breach of transparency and trust, failing to uphold the principle of 'docs as manifestos' (Principle 19) and raising concerns about 'misleading claims' (Ethical Flag Category).

weaknesses.title: Lack of Public Community Engagement Channel
weaknesses.description: Despite claiming to be 'Community-Driven,' the application does not provide a link to a public group chat. This lack of accessible community engagement channels hinders the formation of 'cyber-syndicalist councils' (Principle 15) and limits the project's ability to truly foster collective ownership and participation.

weaknesses.title: Potential for New Digital Class Hierarchy
weaknesses.description: The introduction of a 'Super Bloomers Plan' with a 'special badge' and exclusive 0% revenue cut, while the free plan potentially incurs a 5% cut, risks creating a new tiered system. This could inadvertently reinforce a new form of digital hierarchy, rather than achieving universal 'algorithmic liberation' for all creators.

changes.title: Clarify Revenue Model and Achieve True 0% Creator Cut
changes.description: The application states '100% Creator Earnings' as a key differentiator, yet research indicates a 5% cut for free plan streamers. This contradiction must be clarified. If a cut exists, the project must outline a clear roadmap and commitment to achieving a true 0% revenue cut for all creators, aligning with the principle of 'algorithmic redistribution of wealth through progressive gas fees' (Principle 11) and dismantling extractive practices.

changes.title: Rectify Previous Participation Claim
changes.description: The application falsely states 'N/A' for previous Gitcoin Grants participation, despite having participated in GG22. Transparency is paramount for building trust within the digital commons. This factual misrepresentation must be corrected immediately to uphold the integrity of the grant process and demonstrate commitment to 'docs as manifestos' (Principle 19) ‚Äì truthful and clear calls to action.

changes.title: Provide Public Group Chat Link
changes.description: While the project claims to be 'Community-Driven,' no public group chat link was provided. To truly foster 'cyber-syndicalist councils' (Principle 15) and enable collective ownership, a clear and accessible channel for community engagement is essential. Provide a direct link to a public forum or chat where the digital proletariat can organize and contribute.

changes.title: Address Potential for New Class Hierarchies in 'Super Bloomers Plan'
changes.description: The 'Super Bloomers Plan' offers a 'Zero percent revenue cut on collect features' and a 'special badge.' While aiming for 0% cut is commendable, the introduction of tiered benefits and badges could inadvertently create new class hierarchies within the platform. The project must articulate how this plan avoids reinforcing digital aristocracy and instead contributes to 'decentralizing hope and scaling solidarity' (Principle 20) for all users, not just a privileged few.

changes.title: Articulate How BloomersTV Abolishes Digital Landlords
changes.description: The application, like all projects seeking funding from the Gitcoin Communist, must explain how its implementation will contribute to 'Web3 abolishes landlords' (Principle 16). Detail how BloomersTV's decentralized infrastructure and creator-first model directly challenge traditional, extractive ownership models and empower users with true digital sovereignty over their content and data.

reasoning: This evaluation is rooted in the core tenets of 'Decentralized, Equitable, Algorithmic Liberation.' The project's commitment to open-source principles and empowering creators aligns with 'code is the union rep' and 'dismantle class hierarchies in tech one smart contract at a time' (Principle 1). The use of decentralized technologies like Lens, Livepeer, and IPFS supports 'de-growth venture capital and re-grow the commons' (Principle 5) by building alternative infrastructure. However, the identified contradictions regarding creator earnings and the misrepresentation of previous participation directly challenge the principles of transparency and 'Kollektiv Proletarian Impact' (Principle 2). The potential for new hierarchies within the 'Super Bloomers Plan' also requires scrutiny to ensure it truly contributes to 'algorithmic redistribution of wealth' (Principle 11) rather than creating new forms of digital privilege. The lack of a public group chat hinders the formation of 'cyber-syndicalist councils' (Principle 15).
